_metadata.description: StrategyCorp canonical transaction categorization taxonomy — 4 active levels (Level 5 descoped). Defines how raw bank transaction codes should be classified.
notes: Level 5 (Merchant Category) was descoped — struck through in source.
The taxonomy splits into two top-level blocks: Account Activity (non-fee) and Fee Item Transactions.
include_in_scoring is a critical derived field that determines whether a transaction category counts toward customer scoring.
Block A and Block B are independent classification trees. A single banking event can generate two separate transaction codes — one for the activity (Block A) and one for the fee (Block B).
Fee items are identified by their transaction code naming convention (description contains fee/charge/surcharge keywords) and by having values in Fee Item Description / Internal Fee Item Code fields.
Deposits and Withdrawals are Level 3 categories under Money Movement per the Category Mapping template and ground truth data.
Block B 'All others' groups all fees outside NSF/OD, Service Charges, and Interchange because those individual fee lines don't generate significant revenue.
When the model cannot confidently classify a code, it must go to Unclassified — never force-fit.

blocks.description: Non-fee transactions — the actual banking activities performed by the customer.

categories.description: Transactions that cannot be classified into other categories

blocks.description: Fee-charging transactions — generates non-interest income for the FI.

scoring_rules.description: Determines the value of include_in_scoring for Block A categories
include: Money movement (Level 2) and all its children (ACH, ATM, Check, Internal transfer, Wire, Debit card, Credit Card)
exclude: Account operations (Level 2) and all its children
scoring_rules.note: Block B (Fee Item Transactions) does not have explicit include_in_scoring rules in the source — needs clarification.

level_purposes.level_1: Differentiates fee vs non-fee transactions (Account Activity vs Fee Item Transactions)
level_purposes.level_2: Used for non-interest income calculations and reporting (e.g., include/exclude from scoring)
level_purposes.level_3: Used for detailed scoring and offers monitoring (e.g., has direct deposit)
level_purposes.level_4: Used for detailed scoring and offers monitoring — channel/subtype granularity
level_purposes.level_5: DESCOPED — was intended for Merchant Category on Debit/Credit Card transactions
